children.p: "Go away.  I don't wish to speak with you."
"Oh, you again."
"Good fellow, welcome back."

children.text: In this crowded tavern, a distinctly out-of-place patron hunches over a table, pointedly not interacting with anybody else.  His clothes are silken and expensive, embroidered with flamboyant colors and overlapping layers.  He keeps a twitchy hand near the small satchel at his side, as if he is afraid that somebody is liable take it at any moment.

choices.text: Excuse me, can I ask you some questions?
Whatchya got in that bag there, mister?
What are you doing in this rabble, nobleman?

children.p: "Hmph. Make it quick, I'm in no mood for chatter."

He snatches the bag onto his lap.

"This is my property.  Nothing you should be concerned about."
"Trust me, I'm not here by choice.  I'd have been long gone if not for the damn Blackrose Estate.  But it's the least offensive place in this town right now, if you can believe it."

choices.text: Why do you seem so on edge?
There's a guy across the bar who doesn't like you.

children.p: "Lord Barto Caldeburn. Apparently, that name doesn't have much sway around here like it does on the Mainland.  But mark my words.  It will soon."
"I'm on a business trip.  I need to visit Boramark in the north to discus trade with the Guildimarche Estate."

choices.text: Why haven't you gone to Boramark yet?

children.p: "The blockade, of course!  Nobody in Alinea is going anywhere unless that's been taken care of.  And the Realm sure is taking their sweet time with it."

"I don't know the details. The Realm guards informed me I can't go to Boramark by way of the east road, and apparently the north road is blocked off by some bothersome bandits so that's no good either.  I am to wait until the situation resolves.  And it's taking an infuriatingly long time."

"Only a Lark would ask a question like that.  The Guildimmarche Estate is one of the most powerful noble houses on the Island.  They just so happen to control the lands around Boramark to the north, and I just so happen to have business with them."
"That's what I've heard, yes.  I'm not about to take any chances with that sort of riff raff.  Me, alone on the road?  I'd be ripe for the picking."

choices.text: Yes you would be... Are you interested in hiring a guard?

children.p:
"Ha, are you referring to yourself?  Pardon my bluntness, but you look like a Lark, and on top of that, hardly the caliber of warrior that would ease my safety."

"No, I'll just wait for the situation to resolve, then I'll be on my way."
"Better to be safe than sorry."
"If you have to ask, then you are one."
"I fear that I'll be stuck in the damnable tavern for longer than I'll appreciate."
"Of course there is.  If it isn't obvious I stick out here like a sore thumb.  Why do you mention him?  Is he planning to do something to me?"

choices.text: No, I just thought you should know.
Maybe you could go talk to him.  You could be great friends!

children.p: "Well, I thank you for stating the obvious."
"I am in no mood to make friends with a cretin who is openly hostile to me!"
"What about it?"
"Insofar as they don't interrupt my operations as they are so often liable to do.  At the moment they are not dealing with the blockade, so I am justifiably irked with them."
"Do not dally here long, or I will have you removed."
Chem is still here, sitting quietly in his blue robe.
"I see you have returned.  It is good to see you."
A diminutive man in a blue robe sits quietly behind a desk.  He is bald, with patterned tattoos cascading across his scalp.  The word CHEM is also tattooed on an exposed part of his chest.
"I am Chem.  Apprentice Chem.  My master is Sorcerer Evander of the Voxi Tower."
"Yes.  Please do not touch the merchandise unless you intend to purchase."
"Thank you for your patronage."
"Yes, of the Magi on the Island.  I am working off the debt I have to the school before I return home.  If you would like to buy something, please let me know."

choices.text: Tell me about your master, Sorcerer Evander.
Why is the Island so interesting for the Magi to study?

children.p: "What would you like to discus?"

"The Magi are a collection of scholars who support each other in efforts to study the peculiarities of the Island.  We have two enclaves, but both are on the Southern Peninsula, quite a fair ways from Alinea."

"Yes.  Sorcerer Evander only agreed to my apprenticeship if I could show him my worth.  I promised him a substantial sum of money such that he could continue his research.  I am currently in the process of acquiring that sum."
"My master is a high-ranking official of the Magi, and he resides in the southern enclave.  He studies the strange reaction that Sapphiron seems to have when brought to the Island."
"A somewhat rare material native to the Mainland."

choices.text: What changes about Sapphiron on the Island?
Why does your master study it?
If I find some Sapphiron, I'll be sure to let you know.

children.p: "Can't you feel it? The Island has a strange energy to it, a mystery that's begging to be discovered.  The Realm and the nobility squabble over it for its strategic importance, but they are missing the big picture.  The Island has something about it that we simply MUST discover."

choices.text: I don't know what you're talking about.
I suppose it does feel... different.

children.p: "A Lark like you might not see it, but stay here a while longer and you'll understand."
"Keep that feeling in the back of your mind.  It is important and could help you some day."
"Its color, its texture...  Benign things, but important. Sorcerer Evander swears it vibrates on its own from time to time."

"He believes that there is great significance in the changes it exhibits when Sapphiron is brought to the Island.  By now most other of the Magi have disregarded it as unimportant, but he is the only one who continues to study it."
"That would be most appreciated."
"Alas, no.  It is rare, and expensive.  If only I could get my hands on some, my master would be most pleased!  He might even be willing to reduce my debt if I brought him some."

"Not particularly good.  The Realm and the Blackrose have some disagreement, but it is not my fight.  I will remain steadfast in Alinea regardless of who is in charge, to pay off my debt to the Magi eventually."

choices.text: Poor thing.  Maybe I could help with the debt?

children.p: "Yes.  I am acquiring money for my master, Sorcerer Evander."
"Thank you."
"I appreciate your concern, but I will handle my problems on my own."
"What do you want now?  I'm busy."
"Yes? What can I do for you?"
"Ah, I'm honored that you would approach me.  Did you want something?"

children.text:
A tall woman in a green cloak is overseeing the people at the docks. She tightly clutches an official-looking scroll, and her stern eyes flit in irritation between it and you.

"You there! Are you the Captain of that vessel?"  She points towards the horizon where Argow's vessel is anchored.

choices.text: No. The Captain's name is Argow.  He's still back there in the row boat.
Do I look like I know my way around a ship, lady?  Cuz I don't.
Oh please.  If I owned a ship it would be *much* larger.
I have some questions for you.

children.text: "There's a fee for using the Alinea docks."  She gives you a quick look up and down.  "Even if it is to drop off a... passenger."

choices.text: Tell the Captain yourself if you have need of him.
You don't understand!  They kidnapped me and intend to strand me here!
You really care about that small rowboat?

children.p: "Whatever conflict in which you are allegedly involved does not matter to me. That vessel is here illegally and must be dealt with."

She looks you up and down once more and seems to decide something.

"Hmph. Very well.  I suppose the problem is moot for now.  As for you...  You are not guilty of any more violations.  You are officially allowed to move along into Alinea without retribution. I am Dockmaster Claire, and I run these docks.  Try not to be a nuisance, lark."

children.text: "I can have you locked up for negligence if this situation isn't dealt with right now!"

choices.text: I don't know what to tell you.
Just try it. I dare you.
Sorry!  Um, I don't think he intends to come back.
Can you tell me more about Sadelica?
Can you help me? (Explain your situation)
You called me a "lark" before.  What is that?
You said somebody named Mullen could help?

children.p: "No.  The Realm is not in service of any old lark that gets dropped off at the docks.  You could bother Mullen at the Realm office, he might be more charitable.  But perhaps you'll have some more luck at the local tavern.  That's where larks tend to congregate."
"What do you want to know?"
"This is the port of Alinea.  Just stay out of the Realm's way.  Obey the rules, and you'll have no problems."

"Yes.  It means you're new to the Island of Sadelica."

Sadelica.  You have heard of this place.  It is a large landmass, far, far away from the Mainland.  It has only been settled recently; in the last 50 years.  Rumor has it that it is a place of lawlessness and adventure, although not many on the Mainland have been there to confirm.

"Every day I talk to larks like you.  I have no time to fritter away explaining day-to-day knowledge.  The Realm entrusts me with the smooth operation of Alinea's docks.  You are in the town of Alinea, which itself is on a body of land we call the Island.  That is what I will tell you."
"If you are done with your questions, then move along."

"The Realm is the authority here in Alinea.  That means you need to follow our rules.  I don't have time to sit down and explain society to a lark.  Go bother somebody else if you want to know all this frivolousness.  Lieutenant Mullen might humor you."
"Yes.  Lieutenant Mullen.  He has command of Alinea at the moment.  For whatever reason he, seems to like entertaining larks.  Look for him in the Realm offices to the south west."
"I don't take kindly to you.  Why don't you mosey out of here so I don't have to smell you."
"You need something?"
"Welcome back, want a beer?"

The man behind the bar is large and imposing, with big shoulders and a wide frame. He quietly listens to patrons orders, and hands out massive tankards of beer with a neutral expression, working with steady calm and efficiency.  He's very busy, as he appears to be working alone.  Patrons fill the bar, and several of them wave their hands or shout for his attention from across the tavern floor.  When he sees you, he raises his eyebrows expectantly, waiting for an order or a question.

choices.text: Do you have any open rooms?
You mentioned not being a fan of the Guildimarche?

children.p: "Gruff.  Did you want something?"
"Yep. As you can see things are busy.  So if you don't mind, could you tell me what you want so I can get to everyone who needs me?"
"No.  But the blockade's been leaving people out to dry lately.  Lots of stuck folk need a place to stay and drink.  Lucky me."
"I'm booked up.  I can get you a drink though."

children.text: "I got Guildimarche Ale or Pappy's.  A Coin each."

children.p: "Suit yourself."
"I ain't a big fan of the Guildimarche Estate, so I'd have to go with Pappy's."
"Sure."  He grabs a large tankard and pours a light-colored, frothy liquid into it before handing it to you.
"Right."  He grabs a large tankard and pours a dark, nearly flat liquid into it before handing it to you.
"Anything else?"
"Sorry.  I'm booked up."
"Drink what you got first, then ask for another."

children.comment: TODO Try something where if you get really drunk on Pappy's he'll be more liable to talk to you.

children.p: "Forget I said anything.  It's not my place."

children.comment: TODO Get him to hint that Guildimarche is evil, maybe add a quest around this?

children.p:
How embarrassing!  You don't even have a coin to spare for a beer...

"Come back when you got money."
"I don't know much.  It's some business between the Realm and nobility.  I don't take a side, just deal with the consequences."
"I don't got nothing to say to you."
"Yeah?  You want something?"
"Hello again, friend."

A middle-aged dockworker sips a tankard of beer.  His eyes are locked on a patron across the bar.  At your approach, he blinks a few times before turning his gaze to you.  "Yeah?  You want something?"

choices.text: Let's talk about that nobleman you don't like.

children.p: "Yeah.  You were just speaking to him.  That noble over there.  I don't like him."  He indicates a lone well-dressed man across the bar.
"That noble over there.  I don't like him."  He indicates a lone well-dressed man across the bar,

choices.text: Can you elaborate on the Guildimarche?
It seems like you talk from experience.
I could play a prank on him if you like!

children.p: "I don't like their type.  They don't belong here."
"Nobles who fawn after the Guildimarche."
"What are you, a Lark?  If you don't know them, then just know that they're bad news."

He takes a long drag from his tankard. "Look here.  The Guildimarche are a sort of recluse nobility.  They've got a lot of power and influence, but they're not gaudy like the Blackrose are.  Instead, they're more like a colony of cockroaches.  They silently buy up land all over the Island; they get people in charge who are sympathetic to them; and they infest the land with their people."

"When they've permeated your home, they start running things their way.  Did you want to buy medicine? Well you can't because a the infirmary has it on reserve for those who are favored.  Want to get food for your family?  Get to the back of the line, unless you've got money or connections, because you are worthless dirt in their eyes otherwise."
"I didn't use to be a fisherman here in Alinea.  I used to have a wife and kids.  Don't ask me about 'em."
"Igmund.  I'm a dockworker."
"What about him?"
"Oh yeah?  What are you going to do?"

choices.text: Um.. let's see...  I could go outside, get a rock, and throw it at his head?

children.p: "That's a shame."
He laughs.  "Gruff won't like that, but I definitely would."
"I thought you said prank.  I don't want to be associated with no murdering."
"What are you doing in my office?"
"Did you need something?"
"It's good to see you again.  How can I assist?"

children.text: Suddenly, a shiver passes across your body.  You feel an all-too-familiar feeling: a contending set of forces battling in your mind, all trying to make their opinion known, all trying to shape who you are.

choices.text: Yes sir!  I am reporting that I have arrived here!  Do I get a reward?
Is everyone okay here?  It seems kind of tense.  Can I do anything to help?
I'd never stoop to be under someone else's command.
This place is a mess!  Someone in authority like yourself ought to demoted for such a shameful display.

children.p: "Ah of course.  Forgive my supposition.   I am Lieutenant Mullen of the Realm, and I am in charge here.  Is there anything you require?"
"Listen here! Alinea and The Realm are experiencing enough trouble without some random nobody coming in here and telling me how to do my job!  If you need something from me, then tell me."
"And who exactly are you?  I see not that you're not a soldier, so I apologize for the supposition.  I am Lieutenant Mullen of the Realm.  Can I assist you?"
"Yes.  Lieutenant Mullen of the Realm.  How can I assist you?"

choices.text: Why do you think the blockade is happening?
The Realm can't do anything about the blockade?

children.p:
"Alinea is the only port on the northern side of the the Island.  There are settlements further into the region, but they are only easily accessible via two trails.  One to the north, and one to the east."

"The Blackrose Estate has brought a corps of mercenaries to camp out on the eastern road, and they are preventing anyone with so much as a one-donkey cart from passing through.  This has left many unhappy merchants and travelers to fester in the streets of Alinea."
"Times are tough.  My forces are stretched thin keeping order in this town as the Blackrose blockade continues to exist."
"Greed.  The Blackrose wants to own Alinea.  It's a strategic port on the north side of the Island.  The Blackrose are known for taking the things that they want."

"The Blackrose Estate is a powerful noble family that is always causing trouble on the Island. They are not loyal to the Empress, but due to their immense wealth, they buy allegiance from desperate ne'er-do-wells."

"There are more members of the Blackrose family than I can count.  And they all seem to be out here on the Island in some shape or another."
"Rest assured, the Realm is doing everything it can to alleviate the blockade.  But Aldebeth Blackrose is being stubborn."
"She's in charge of the Blackrose contingent of the blockade.  Stubborn woman."

"The Realm is a distributed military on the Island, organized in service of the Mainland Empress herself, long may she reign.  Somebody's got ensure some kind of order here.  I'm the current highest ranking officer in Alinea."

choices.text: Where are the other commanding officers?
We're awfully far from the Mainland.  Does the Empress have any pull here at all?

children.p: "They are Somewhere else.  The Realm stations officers where it sees fit."
"She has enough pull to keep us loyal citizens of the Mainland trusting and following her lead."
"What about you?  Are you loyal to the Empress?"
"You've made your thoughts on this matter clear already."

choices.text: Yes, of course.  Long live the Empress!"
The Empress is too far away to govern me.
I'm not really into politics, to be honest.

children.p: "Indeed.  It is good to see loyalist blood still strong out here."
"The Empress may not be here, but her command lives through us in the Realm."
"No opinion?  You can't remain neutral forever.  Sooner or later you'll need to pick a side."

You explain to Mullen about how you arrived to Alinea on a vessel and that you are stranded.

"You have my sympathies, but I am in no position to do anything for you right now."
"What about it?"

choices.text: Could I get somebody to take me back to the Mainland?
Does the number "9" have any special significance to you?

children.p: "Sure.  Ask around.  It won't be cheap though.  The trip out here, as you well know, is quite long."

"The Realm teaches is soldiers to always have an objective, and to make due with what they have.  You're here now, whether you want to be or not.  You could settle down, get a job, or you could figure out a way to get home.  Either way, it's something to strive towards."
"No.  Not particularly."

A slumped man in a green military uniform sits behind a sturdy desk. His head rests in palm as he reads a scroll, his tired eyes tracking back and forth.  The suit of armor on the rack behind him is dusty and unused, as is the saber mounted above it in a stout display case.  A little metal nameplate at the front of his desk has 'Lieutenant Mullen' etched into it.

"Pardon me.  Sorry about the mess.  It's been a rough time lately.  Did you have something to report?"
"Times are tough, that's true.  I'm Lieutenant Mullen of the Realm.  How can I assist you?"
"I've got my eye on you."
"Are you interested in my wares?"
"Nice to see you."
"Welcome to my little corner of Alinea.  I've got a little bit of everything, so don't be shy about looking around.  Or if you just want to talk, that's fine too.  It's been pretty slow lately."

choices.text: Got any opinions on what's happening in Alinea right now?
Can you show me your wares?

children.p: "Scopey.  Proud member of the Merchantry."
"At the moment, yes.  I've got to make do with current circumstances.  I'm sure you've heard about the blockade.  When that's been resolved I'll pack all this up and head east."

"A collection of us merchants decided to band together to watch each others backs.  Out here on the Island, you need all the allies you can get, especially with the nobility and Realm always throwing their weight around."
"If you've got a letter of acceptance into the Merchantry, you can bet we'll take good care of you."
"Thanks for browsing."
"Of course I do.  You want to know something in particular?"

choices.text: When do you think the blockade will end?
Why won't the Realm let Elvyosa's ship leave?
What do you think of the Blackrose?
What do you think of the Realm?

children.p: "Soon, I hope.  I won't have these wares forever.  Of course if it doesn't end soon, I'll cut ties and and leave with Elvyosa.  She owes me that much at least."
"Another fellow Merchantry member.  She's a ship captain of one of the sloops out their on the docks.  Though she's stuck until the Realm lets her leave."
"It's best if you asked her yourself.  Though, tell her I sent you!"

"I don't have anything against them normally.  In fact, I sell goods to them all the time.  But this whole blockade is bad for business and causing the Merchantry some real issues, so they're not particularly on my good side."

"They're a group of annoying bureaucrats who think the Empress from the Mainland will eventually pay attention to the Island.  I don't deal with them directly myself, by my fellows of the Merchantry do often.  They are, unfortunately, a necessary annoyance."

"Because without them, this whole place would be decorated in Blackrose red.  As pitiful as their reason is for supporting the Mainland, the Realm still has a bast amount of resources they can throw around.  They keep the power struggle balanced, and as such, keep the Island profitable."

In this alley is a hastily-constructed makeshift shop of some sort.  A collection of mismatched tables are aligned in rows, holding various and sundry trinkets or utensils.  Two large wagons are arranged behind the tables, and these have been opened up to hold yet more merchandise, from clothing to grain and even fresh fruit.  A short man leans casually on one of these wagons, smoking a corn-cob pipe.
"Yes?  You need something?"

A well-dressed nobleman is ordering about workers beside a large warehouse.  He appears very busy, but if he is at all vexed by your approach, he hides it well behind a practiced smile and a curt bow.

"I see you need something from me?  What can I do for you?"

"Lord Shovan-Abivola, at your service.  My wife and I run these these warehouses in Alinea."

He gestures broadly, indicating several of the warehouses around you.
"Lord Shovan-Abivola, at your service.  My wife and I run these these warehouses in Alinea."

"Yes, warehouses five through eight.  Good investments from the past.  You can see how useful they are.  Well, usually.  With the blockade we have been scrambling to re-organize and re-negotiate perishable and high-risk items.  It's quite a headache, actually."
"Like what, exactly?"

choices.text: Could I store something in your warehouses?
Does the blockade hinder your operations?
What do you think of the Blackrose?
Are you part of the Merchantry?

children.p: "That depends.  What do you want to store?"

choices.text: I don't actually need to store anything.

children.p: "Right, right."

children.comment: TODO: Allow storage of important items.  If Blackrose takes over town, these items will remain in storage.

children.p: "It's both good and bad.  When travel stagnates, so does what we store.  That means profits as we sell space for longer than clients had first anticipated, but other more perishable items do cause us trouble."

"Our families go way back from the Mainland.  I deal with them all the time.  Obviously they aren't popular around Alinea nowadays, but I'd never turn down a paying customer, especially one I consider close to family."
"Heavens no!  Even if I wanted to be included in their rabble, I doubt they'd let a nobleman in like myself."
"You have returned, I see."
This man is staring out at the ocean unflinchingly.  He wears a peculiar purple robe, tattered at the fringes, and his hood is pulled up enough to obscure most of his face.

choices.text: What are you doing over here?

children.p: "Ah yes.  I suppose... you could call me Sol."
"I seek those that are worthy of attention."

choices.text: And they come from the ocean?

children.p: "Of course.  Those who are already on the Island have proven to be insufficient."

He gives you a pointed look-over.

"Perhaps.  I will know more as time passes."
"Attention."
"Before you go, you should know that your actions are being watched, and judged.  You should take care to think before you act."

choices.text: Come on, you have to tell me more than that...

children.p: "The powers the be."
"You would not understand.  Act and your character will be revealed.  You cannot hide it."

children.text: So what do you think?  Are you up for the task?

choices.text: This all seems so very silly if you ask me!  But sure, I guess.
Of course I am.  Do not insinuate otherwise.
I will do what needs to be done.
